meanings.definition: The visible shape or configuration of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully studied the forms of the sculptures in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The forms of the clouds in the sky constantly change throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The child giggled, pointing at the strange forms the shadows made on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were like fluid forms flowing gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The intricate forms of the snowflakes sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A document with blank spaces to be filled in.
meanings.sent1: Please complete the forms with your personal information before submitting them.
meanings.sent2: The receptionist handed me a stack of forms to fill out at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled coffee on the important forms, causing a big mess.
meanings.sent4: The teacher reminded the students to return the signed forms by the end of the week.
meanings.sent5: The tax forms were confusing, so I asked for help from a professional.

meanings.definition: A type or variety of something.
meanings.sent1: There are many different forms of art, including painting, sculpture, and music.
meanings.sent2: The library offers various forms of entertainment, such as books, movies, and audiobooks.
meanings.sent3: The garden was filled with colorful forms of flowers, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent4: Each season brings its own unique forms of weather, from snow in winter to sunshine in summer.
meanings.sent5: The bakery specializes in different forms of pastries, from croissants to muffins.

meanings.sent1: She forms the clay into a beautiful vase with her skilled hands.

meanings.sent3: The children decided to form a band and practice playing music together.
meanings.sent4: The architect will form a new design for the building based on the client's preferences.
meanings.sent5: The team will work together to form a plan for the upcoming project.
